name.language: Unspecified, see website description

property.note: See also codes 17 and 18

name.language: Publisher’s corporate website

property.note: A publisher’s informative and/or promotional webpage relating to a specified work (book, journal, online resource or other publication type)

name.language: Publisher’s website for a specified work

property.note: A webpage giving access to an online content hosting service as a whole

name.language: Online hosting service home page

property.note: A webpage giving general information about a serial, in print or electronic format or both

name.language: Journal home page

property.note: A webpage giving direct access to the content that is available online for a specified resource version. Generally used for content available online under subscription terms

name.language: Online resource ‘available content’ page

property.note: A webpage maintained by an author or other contributor about their publications and personal background

name.language: Contributor’s own website

property.note: A publisher’s webpage devoted to a specific author or other contributor

name.language: Publisher’s website relating to specified contributor

property.note: A webpage devoted to a specific author or other contributor, and maintained by a publisher other than the publisher of the item described in the ONIX record

name.language: Other publisher’s website relating to specified contributor

property.note: A webpage devoted to a specific author or other contributor, and maintained by a third party (eg a fan site)

name.language: Third-party website relating to specified contributor

property.note: A webpage maintained by an author or other contributor and specific to an individual work

name.language: Contributor’s own website for specified work

property.note: A webpage devoted to an individual work, and maintained by a publisher other than the publisher of the item described in the ONIX record

name.language: Other publisher’s website relating to specified work

property.note: A webpage devoted to an individual work, and maintained by a third party (eg a fan site)

name.language: Third-party website relating to specified work

property.note: A webpage maintained by an author or other contributor and specific to a group or series of works

name.language: Contributor’s own website for group or series of works

property.note: A publisher’s webpage devoted to a group or series of works

name.language: Publisher’s website relating to group or series of works

property.note: A webpage devoted to a group or series of works, and maintained by a publisher other than the publisher of the item described in the ONIX record

name.language: Other publisher’s website relating to group or series of works

property.note: A webpage devoted to a group or series of works, and maintained by a third party (eg a fan site)

name.language: Third-party website relating to group or series of works (eg a fan site)

property.note: Use instead of code 01 to specify a publisher’s website for trade users

name.language: Publisher’s B2B website

property.note: Use instead of code 01 to specify a publisher’s website for end customers (consumers)

name.language: Publisher’s B2C website

property.note: For example, a Blogger or Tumblr URL, a Wordpress website or other blog URL

name.language: Author blog
Web page for author presentation / commentary
Web page for author interview
Web page for author reading
Web page for cover material
Web page for sample content

property.note: Use this value in the <Website> composite (typically within <Publisher> or <SupplyDetail>) when sending a link to a webpage at which a digital product is available for download and/or online access

name.language: Web page for full content

property.note: For example a subscribable podcast hosting site, social media message, newsletter issue, other commentary

name.language: Web page for other commentary / discussion

property.note: URL needed by the German National Library for direct access, harvesting and storage of an electronic resource

name.language: Transfer-URL

property.note: Link needed by German Books in Print (VLB) for DOI registration and ONIX DOI conversion

name.language: DOI Website Link

property.note: A corporate website operated by a distributor or other supplier (not the publisher)

name.language: Supplier’s corporate website

property.note: A website operated by a distributor or other supplier (not the publisher) and aimed at trade customers

name.language: Supplier’s B2B website

property.note: A website operated by a distributor or other supplier (not the publisher) and aimed at consumers

name.language: Supplier’s B2C website

property.note: A distributor or supplier’s webpage describing a specified work

name.language: Supplier’s website for a specified work

property.note: A distributor or supplier’s webpage describing a specified work, and aimed at trade customers

name.language: Supplier’s B2B website for a specified work

property.note: A distributor or supplier’s webpage describing a specified work, and aimed at consumers

name.language: Supplier’s B2C website for a specified work

property.note: A distributor or supplier’s webpage describing a group or series of works

name.language: Supplier’s website for a group or series of works

property.note: For example an ONIX or MARC record for the product, available online

name.language: URL of full metadata description

property.note: For example, a Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, Pinterest, Tiktok (including Booktok), Twitter (latterly, X) or similar URL for the product or work

name.language: Social networking URL for specific work or product

property.note: For example, a Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, Pinterest, Tiktok (including Booktok), Twitter (latterly, X) or similar page for the contributor

name.language: Author’s social networking URL

property.note: For example, a Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, Pinterest, Tiktok (including Booktok), Twitter (latterly, X) or similar page

name.language: Publisher’s social networking URL

property.note: For example, a Facebook, Instagram, Youtube, Pinterest, Tiktok (including Booktok), Twitter (latterly, X) or similar page. Use only in the context of a specific content item (eg within <ContentItem>)

name.language: Social networking URL for specific article, chapter or content item

property.note: For example, a service offering click-through licensing of extracts

name.language: Publisher’s or third party website for permissions requests

property.note: For example, a page providing details related to GDPR. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

name.language: Publisher’s or third party website for privacy statement

property.note: The URL of the publisher’s preservation service, or a more specific URL for access to its preservation metadata, to provide confirmation of the preservation status of the product. <WebsiteDescription> may contain the name of the service. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

name.language: Publisher’s website for digital preservation

property.note: The URL of the preservation service (eg https://clockss.org), or a more specific URL for access to its preservation metadata, to provide confirmation of the preservation status of the product. <WebsiteDescription> may contain the name of the service. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

name.language: Third-party website for digital preservation

property.note: The URL of a web page describing the environmental and sustainability policy, or carbon neutrality status, that applies to the specific product. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

name.language: Product website for environmental responsibility statement

property.note: The URL of a web page describing the environmental and sustainability policies, carbon neutrality status, etc of the organization (publisher, supplier etc). For environmental sustainability of the product itself, see List 79. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

name.language: Organization’s website for environmental responsibility statement

property.note: The URL of a digital legal deposit service (eg https://www.legaldeposit.org.uk), or a more specific URL for access to its preservation metadata, to provide confirmation of the digital legal deposit status of the product. <WebsiteDescription> may contain the name of the service. Only for use in ONIX 3.0 or later

name.language: Legal deposit website for digital preservation
